name: cfinclude
description: Includes the content from the referenced file (template). The content may be executed as CFML, see compatibility info below. You can embed cfinclude tags recursively. For another way to encapsulate CFML, see cfmodule. (A CFML page was formerly sometimes called a CFML template or a template.)

params.name: template
params.description: A logical path to a CFML page.

params.name: runonce
params.description: CF10+ If set to true, the given template is not processed again for a given request if it has already been processed.

coldfusion.notes:
CF9: Added the script syntax: include.
CF11: Changed behaviour such that only files with the extension cfm or cfml are compiled and executed by cfinclude (configurable in Application.cfc via this.compileextforinclude), all other files will be statically included.
